intro: Cynarospermum asperrimum, commonly known as the rough cynarospermum, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and robust growth habits. The plant is notable for its spiny, hairy stems and leaves, which contribute to its rugged appearance. Its flowers are typically yellow to orange, with a central disk surrounded by ray florets. Cynarospermum asperrimum is often found in arid or semi-arid regions, adapting well to poor soil conditions.
